title: 1,100-year-old Hebrew Bible sells for $38m, will head to Israel
description: One of the world's oldest surviving Bible manuscripts will be placed in the Museum of the Jewish People in Tel Aviv.

title: Man who killed eight in New York bike path attack sentenced
description: Sayfullo Saipov was given eight consecutive life sentences in the US as part of his punishment for a deadly 2017 attack.

title: Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes to head to prison in two weeks
description: She rose to fame after claiming Theranos's small machines do an array of diagnostic tests with just a few blood drops.

title: Man City thrash Real Madrid 4-0 to reach Champions League final
description: Bernardo Silva scores a brace as City outclass Madrid to win 5-1 on aggregate and set up a final against Inter Milan.

title: El Salvador vows harsh response after slaying of police officer
description: Thousands of soldiers and police have encircled the city of Nueva Concepcion after the killing of a police officer.

title: Ex-paramilitary leader testifies about assassinations in Colombia
description: Salvatore Mancuso, former commander of right-wing paramilitary groups, has offered four days of tribunal testimony.

title: Three pro-democracy activists arrested in Sudan
description: Experts say arrests are part of a broader campaign by the army to consolidate control over aid relief.

title: Ex-Pakistan PM Khan says police surrounded his home in Lahore
description: Imran Khan says he fears re-arrest as police surround his house over claims he is hiding suspects in recent riots.

title: ‘Censorship’: US publisher sues over Florida book restrictions
description: The lawsuit alleges a county in the Republican-led state is cracking down on access to books on race and LGBTQ identity.

title: Turkey’s opposition claim ballot irregularities in Sunday’s polls
description: CHP, YSP voiced concerns and lodged complaints over discrepancies between recorded count and votes registered.

title: First full-sized 3D scan of the Titanic shipwreck captured
description: The high-resolution images reconstruct the wreck, revealing more about the ship's fateful journey across the Atlantic.

title: What are the repercussions of Bashagha’s suspension in Libya?
description: He was appointed prime minister in eastern Libya with a mandate to take over Tripoli.

title: SP Hinduja, billionaire head of UK’s richest family, dies at 87

title: Ivan Toney banned for eight months for breaching betting rules
description: Football Association has also given Brentford and England striker a 50,000-pound ($62,500) fine for 232 breaches.

title: Key takeaways from state and local US elections this week
description: Republican Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, who will likely run for president, faces setbacks in off-year vote on Tuesday.

title: Haiti sees rise of ‘vigilante justice’ as gang violence soars

description: Some 150 signatories call for the release of opposition leader Ghannouchi, saying his arrest is part of a 'witch hunt'.

description: About 30.3 million tonnes of grain have been exported from Ukraine under the Black Sea deal.

description: Kilicdaroglu came second to Erdogan in Sunday's presidential election, and is seeking nationalist support.

description: 'Near catastrophic', two-hour chase in New York caused by 'highly aggressive paparazzi', couple's spokesperson says.

title: Is ‘shareholder supremacy’ driving the layoffs in tech?
description: Listed firms put their shareholders first when making decisions even if it leaves employees susceptible to job cuts.

title: Russia orders arrests of anti-war theatre director, film producer
description: Since Russia invaded Ukraine, Moscow has cracked down on opposition voices, sentencing several to lengthy jail times.

description: Human rights groups say Khalaf al-Rumaithi was among dozens of the UAE critics who faced an 'unfair' mass trial.

title: At least eight dead in north Italy floods; Grand Prix postponed

title: Global warming likely to breach 1.5C threshold for first time

title: Indonesia’s communication minister arrested in corruption case

title: Pakistan official gives Khan 24 hours to hand over riot suspects

title: Kim Jong Un inspects North Korea’s first military spy satellite

title: Pig heads, BBQs: Mosque backlash tests S Korea religious freedom
